text: Bob Jenkins (September 4, 1947 â€“ August 9, 2021) was an American television and radio sports announcer. He was known for announcing IndyCar and NASCAR races for ESPN/ABC and later NBC Sports. He was born in Richmond, Indiana. Jenkins retired in 2013. Jenkins was diagnosed with brain cancer in February 2021. He died on August 9, 2021 in Indianapolis, Indiana from the disease, aged 73. ==References== Category:1947 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American sports commentators Category:People from Richmond, Indiana Category:Deaths from brain cancer
title: Bob Jenkins
